question.title: Network connections to DB not closing

node.contents: Ended up finding the problem in some completely other and entirely forgotten part of code. Thanks tho.

astNode.text: Ended up finding the problem in some completely other and entirely forgotten part of code. Thanks tho.

node.contents: I have a daemon process which makes heavy use of a backend PostgreSQL database. Using netstat I can see a steady increase of network connections to the DB open in ESTABLISHED.

astNode.text: I have a daemon process which makes heavy use of a backend PostgreSQL database. Using netstat I can see a steady increase of network connections to the DB open in ESTABLISHED.

node.contents: A memory dump shows a ton of java.lang.ref.Finalizer. Also, a thread dump shows all the threads in:

astNode.text: A memory dump shows a ton of java.lang.ref.Finalizer. Also, a thread dump shows all the threads in:

elements.contents: "pool-1-thread-6" prio=10 tid=0x0000000000e4d800 nid=0x10eb waiting on condition [0x00007f3736c5b000] java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking) at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method) - parking to wait for <0x00000000c5524bf8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject) at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186) at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043) at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1068) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1130) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)

fragments.text: "pool-1-thread-6" prio=10 tid=0x0000000000e4d800 nid=0x10eb waiting on condition [0x00007f3736c5b000]

units.rawText: "pool-1-thread-6" prio=10 tid=0x0000000000e4d800 nid=0x10eb waiting on condition [0x00007f3736c5b000] java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking) at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)- parking to wait for <0x00000000c5524bf8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject) at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043)at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1068)at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1130)at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)

node.contents: I suspect this is because I use a fixed thread pool Executor Service, and these threads show the Executor trying to conclude threads that have a resource to the DB open.

astNode.text: I suspect this is because I use a fixed thread pool Executor Service, and these threads show the Executor trying to conclude threads that have a resource to the DB open.

node.contents: Here's where I call the close on my various DB resources:

astNode.text: Here's where I call the close on my various DB resources:

elements.contents: InitialContext ctx = null; Connection conn = null; PreparedStatement ps = null; ResultSet rs = null; ... } finally { try { if (rs != null) { rs.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (ps != null) { ps.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (conn != null) { conn.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (ctx != null) { ctx.close(); } } catch (NamingException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } }

units.rawText: InitialContext ctx = null; Connection conn = null; PreparedStatement ps = null; ResultSet rs = null; ... } finally { try { if (rs != null) { rs.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (ps != null) { ps.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (conn != null) { conn.close(); } } catch (SQLException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } try { if (ctx != null) { ctx.close(); } } catch (NamingException e) { Notification n = new Notification(this,e); n.log(); } }

node.contents: I've spent a gross amount of time on this, but no matter what I do I can't seem to pull the thorn out of this code.

astNode.text: I've spent a gross amount of time on this, but no matter what I do I can't seem to pull the thorn out of this code.

node.contents: As a first step I recommend is to use the new Automatic Resource Management feature to close your connections etc.

astNode.text: As a first step I recommend is to use the new Automatic Resource Management feature to close your connections etc.
